td.para: Log Summary: More quantitative image features
CP 1705 added codes for a comprehensive set of texture features, but more features can be extracted from images than are currently included in DICOM.
This CP includes revisions to how to encode features, what features are available, and the description of certain aspects of how they are derived (which affect their interpretation/repeatibility).

Now that IBSI defines its own codes, some DCM codes are no longer necessary and are retired with reference to the IBSI codes. IBSI is added as a coding scheme. Also add the Radiomics Ontology (RO) as a coding scheme, since some concepts are required from it.

An example of usage of a broad range of radiomic features, without reference to standard definitions and highlighting the need for them, is found in Kalpathy-Cramer J et al. Radiomics of Lung Nodules: A Multi-Institutional Study of Robustness and Agreement of Quantitative Imaging Features. Tomography. 2016 Dec;2(4):430–7. .]

The proposed quantitative image features context group includes generic size and intensity measurements and hence the measurement parameter invoked in TID 1500 are simplified. The title of the the context group is "quantitative image features" rather than "radiomics" since these have more general applications than just radiology.

para.emphasis: [Ed.Note.: Update IBSI coding scheme with new reference when published (current v6 on arXiv does not contain the codes.]
[Ed.Note.: Use references to RO for kinds of matrices rather than defining them in Annex D (e.g., GLCM)?]
[Ed.Note.: Add CODE and TEXT numeric parameters to TID 300 and TID 1419 to handle methods and stuff]

[Ed.Note.: Add Local Binary Patterns (LBP), 2D+t (dynamic) features as used in Larroza A, López-Lereu MP, Monmeneu JV, Gavara J, Chorro FJ, Bodí V, et al. Texture analysis of cardiac cine magnetic resonance imaging to detect nonviable segments in patients with chronic myocardial infarction. Med Phys [Internet]. 2018 Feb [cited 2018 Feb 25]; Available from: http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/mp.12783/abstract ]

[Ed. Note. Add Fourier features, e.g., as referenced from Cunliffe AR, Armato SG, Fei XM, Tuohy RE, Al-Hallaq HA. Lung texture in serial thoracic CT scans: Registration-based methods to compare anatomically matched regions. Med Phys. 2013 Jun 1;40(6Part1):.]
[Ed. Note. consider referencing textbooks., e.g., Pratt, Chapter 12 of Computer Vision - Wagner.]
[Ed. Note. Add fractal dimension calculation methods summarized in Cunliffe (blanket, Brownian motion, box counting)]
[Ed.Note.: Add parameters, e.g., for GLCM, thresholds, number of gray levels, number of directions (? list them), step distance, method (2D or 3D +/- merging); see :

Foy JJ, Mitta P, Nowosatka LR, Mendel KR, Li H, Giger ML, et al. Variations in algorithm implementation among quantitative texture analysis software packages. In: Medical Imaging 2018: Computer-Aided Diagnosis [Internet]. International Society for Optics and Photonics; 2018 [cited 2018 Mar 9]. p. 105751K. Available from: http://dx.doi.org/10.1117/12.2292573

Emaminejad N, Wahi-Anwar M, Hoffman J, Kim GH, Brown MS, McNitt-Gray M. The effects of variations in parameters and algorithm choices on calculated radiomics feature values: initial investigations and comparisons to feature variability across CT image acquisition conditions. In: Medical Imaging 2018: Computer-Aided Diagnosis [Internet]. International Society for Optics and Photonics; 2018 [cited 2018 Mar 8]. p. 105753W. Available from: http://dx.doi.org/10.1117/12.2293864]
[Ed. Note.: means to identify/distinguish intensity mask and morphological mask for SEG and contours per IBSI Image Processing description]

[Ed.Note.: Are all features ROI only, or can they also be Quantity for images? IBSI is only about ROIs, but Pratt textbook discusses computation of GLCM on sufficient "window" size to be statistically reliable.]

[Ed.Note.: Test case - check have sufficient coverage of features in Al-Kadi OS. Assessment of texture measures susceptibility to noise in conventional and contrast enhanced computed tomography lung tumour images. Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics. 2010 Sep 1;34(6):494–503.]

[Ed.Note.: For color features (e.g., slide microscopy) consider how to parameterize with which channel and/or ,mean of channels texture applies to; compare with Table 1: "List of the patch level texture features for red and blue channel" in Wen S, Kurc TM, Gao Y, Zhao T, Saltz JH, Zhu W. A methodology for texture feature-based quality assessment in nucleus segmentation of histopathology image. Journal of Pathology Informatics. 2017 Jan 1;8(1):38. doi: 10.4103/jpi.jpi_43_17]
[Ed.Note.: Are the features the base quantity (the measurement itself) or the Derivation (e.g.,, texture feature of ADC, T2WI, SUV, CT HU, esp. in same Study)?]
Amend DICOM PS3.16 as follows (changes to existing text are bold and underlined for additions and struckthrough for removals):

section.title: Normative References
section.para: The following standards contain provisions that, through reference in this text, constitute provisions of this Standard. At the time of publication, the editions indicated were valid. All standards are subject to revision, and parties to agreements based on this Standard are encouraged to investigate the possibilities of applying the most recent editions of the standards indicated below.

biblioset.title: Image biomarker standardisation initiative - feature definitions

th.para: Coding Scheme Resources Sequence (0008,0109) Type: URL

section.label: TID 300
section.title: Measurement
section.para: This Template provides a general structure for a numeric measurement, together with evaluations of its normality and/or significance, and the inference source(s) for its value. This structure is instantiated by inclusion of this Template with specific contextual parameters from a parent Template.

td.para: Coded term or Context Group for Concept Name of measurement
Modifier Name for Concept Name of measurement
Modifier Value for Concept Name of measurement
Value(s) for Anatomic Location of measurement
Modifier Value for Anatomic Location of measurement
Coded term or Context Group for the equation or table from which the measurement was derived or computed
Purpose of Reference for an image used as a source of the measurement
Purpose of Reference for a waveform used as a source of the measurement
Bibliographic reference or authority for statistical properties of a reference population
Bibliographic reference or authority for the normal range of the measurement
Coded term or Context Group for Concept Name of a derivation parameter
EV (121050, DCM, "Equivalent Meaning of Concept Name")
EV (126100, DCM, "Real World Value Map used for measurement")
SOP Class UID shall be Real World Value Mapping Storage ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.67")

The HAS CONCEPT MOD items allow the explicit definition of terms for post-coordination of the measurement concept name. Additional post-coordinated modifier terms may be included in a SOP Instance based on this Template, in accordance with section 6.2.4, or as defined by Templates that invoke this Template and explicitly define additional post-coordinated modifiers (e.g., TID 5203).

Finding site may be multiple when a region of interest spans multiple anatomical locations and there is not a single pre-coordinated code describing the combination of locations. E.g., when a maligant, inflammatory or traumatic process spans actual or defined anatomical boundaries. There is no requirement that the multiple locations be contiguous.

The INFERRED FROM items allow the specification (by-value or by-reference) of numeric values that were used in the derivation of the numeric measurement of Row 1. The nature of the inference is not explicitly conveyed; it may be implicit in the Concept Names of the measurements. Inference by-reference is valid only in SOP Classes that permit the INFERRED FROM relationship by-reference.

Equivalent Meaning of Concept Name allows the creating application to specify the preferred composed concept name representing the measurement and the associated post-coordinated concept modifiers. The concept modifiers may include those specified in this Template, in a Template that invokes this Template, or at the option of the creating application in accordance with section 6.2.4. This composed concept name may be rendered by a display application.

Row 18 is a reference to an RWV that describes how measurements were made in units that differ from the stored pixel values in the images referenced in Row 13. E.g., for a PET SUVbw measurement, the mapping from activity/concentration units in the referenced image that was used (and which may be reused for measurements in the future) may be encoded in a referenced RWV instance. This reference overrides any reference in an including Template (such as for a Measurement Group).

section.label: TID 310
section.title: Measurement Properties
section.para: This Template provides the properties of a numeric measurement, including evaluations of its normality and/or significance, its relationship to a reference population, and an indication of its selection from a set of measurements.

td.para: Bibliographic reference or authority for statistical properties of a reference population
Bibliographic reference or authority for the normal range of the measurement
Coded term or Context Group for the equation or table from which a measurement was derived or computed
The HAS PROPERTIES allows the specification of the numeric values used as input to the equation or table identified in Row 1.

The HAS PROPERTIES allows the specification by-reference of the numeric values used as input to the equation or table. This row is valid only in SOP Classes that permit the HAS PROPERTIES relationship by-reference.

note.para: For example, if Row 1 identifies a specific Body Surface Area equation, Rows 2 and 3 can be used to convey (by-value or by-reference) the Patient Height and Patient Weight numeric measurements used in the BSA computation.

section.label: TID 1419
section.title: ROI Measurements
section.para: This Template encodes measurements for some metric, e.g., density, flow, or concentration.

td.para: Coded term or Context Group for Concept Name of measurement
Modifier Name for Concept Name of measurement
Modifier Value for Concept Name of measurement
Value(s) for Anatomic Location of measurement
Modifier Value for Anatomic Location of measurement
Coded term or Context Group for the equation or table from which the measurement was derived or computed
Bibliographic reference or authority for statistical properties of a reference population
Bibliographic reference or authority for the normal range of the measurement
Coded term or Context Group for Concept Name of a derivation parameter
EV (121050, DCM, "Equivalent Meaning of Concept Name")
EV (126100, DCM, "Real World Value Map used for measurement")
SOP Class UID shall be Real World Value Mapping Storage ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.67")

Finding site may be multiple when a region of interest spans multiple anatomical locations and there is not a single pre-coordinated code describing the combination of locations. E.g., when a maligant, inflammatory or traumatic process spans actual or defined anatomical boundaries. There is no requirement that the multiple locations be contiguous.

Specifies the metric for which measurements are reported, e.g., density, flow, or concentration. This metric is computed at each sample point (e.g., pixel or voxel) in an ROI (defined in the invoking Template), but those individual point measurements are not encoded. Instead, just the summary measurements for the ROI are encoded, and the means of computing a single value is defined in Row 8 Derivation (e.g., mean).

The HAS CONCEPT MOD items allow the explicit definition of terms for post-coordination of the measurement concept name. Additional post-coordinated modifier terms may be included in a SOP Instance based on this Template, in accordance with section 6.2.4, or as defined by Templates that invoke this Template and explicitly define additional post-coordinated modifiers.

The INFERRED FROM items allow the specification (by-value or by-reference) of numeric values that were used in the derivation of the numeric measurement of Row 1. The nature of the inference is not explicitly conveyed; it may be implicit in the Concept Names of the measurements. Inference by-reference is valid only in SOP Classes that permit the INFERRED FROM relationship by-reference.

Equivalent Meaning of Concept Name allows the creating application to specify the preferred composed concept name representing the measurement and the associated post-coordinated concept modifiers. The concept modifiers may include those specified in this Template, in a Template that invokes this Template, or at the option of the creating application in accordance with section 6.2.4. This composed concept name may be rendered by a display application.

The reference to an RWV in Row 19 allows measurements to be made in units that differ from the stored pixel values in the images referenced in the parent Template. E.g., for a PET SUVbw measurement, the mapping from activity/concentration units in the referenced image that was used (and which may be reused for measurements in the future) may be encoded in a referenced RWV instance. This reference overrides any reference in an including Template (such as for a Measurement Group).

The baseline context groups defined allow for generic intensity and, size , texture and other feature measurements, regardless of the geometry of the ROI (e.g., linear distance can be measured on volumes, or volume can be estimated from a linear distance), and being baseline, do not constrain the invoker from using other appropriate concepts specific to the application.

note.para: (126326, DCM, "IAUC90BN") can be used for DCE-MRI using a Gd-based contrast agent to represent the IAUGCBN measurement in the claim of the QIBA DCE MRI Quantification Profile, though the concept itself is not specific to the modality or the contrast agent used. See . See also Ng, CS., et al. "Reproducibility of Perfusion Parameters in Dynamic Contrast-Enhanced MRI of Lung and Liver Tumors: Effect on Estimates of Patient Sample Size in Clinical Trials and on Individual Patient Responses." AJR 194, no. 2 (February 1, 2010): W134–40. .
The type of contrast agent and the AIF used for blood normalization may or may not be post-coordinated.
E.g., voxel-wise IAUCBN measurements encoded as a parametric map with the quantity defined by the Quantity Definition Sequence (0040,9220) in a Real World Value Map might be encoded as:
E.g., an IAUCBN measurement for an ROI encoded in a structured report might be encoded as:
>HAS CONCEPT MOD: CODE (G-C036, SRT, "Measurement Method") = (126364, DCM, "Blind Estimation of AIF")

Note that the generic ROI measurement templates do not have the contrast/bolus agent as a parameter; this may be implicit from context, or inherited from the (121058, DCM,"Procedure reported") in the parent template.

para.emphasis: HTML | FHIR JSON | FHIR XML | IHE SVS XML

note.para: For the purpose of this context group, where possible, the resonance peak in the spectrum corresponding to a particular metabolite is described using the concept from SNOMED for the substance corresponding to the metabolite. E.g., the code used for "lipid" is the code for "lipid (substance) ", as this concept is effectively post-coordinated by its use in the Metabolite Map Code Sequence (0018,9083) to mean "lipid resonance peaks in MR spectroscopy".

table.label: CID 7277
table.caption: Units of Diffusion Rate Area Over Time

table.label: D-1
table.caption: DICOM Controlled Terminology Definitions (Coding Scheme Designator "DCM" Coding Scheme Version "01")

td.para: A three-dimensional numeric measurement that is approximate, based on a two-dimensional region in a single image.
Volume estimated from three or more non-coplanar 2D regions
A three-dimensional numeric measurement that is approximate, based on three or more non-coplanar two-dimensional image regions.
Volume estimated from two non-coplanar 2D regions
A three-dimensional numeric measurement that is approximate, based on two non-coplanar two-dimensional image regions.
Volume of bounding three dimensional region
A three-dimensional numeric measurement of the bounding region of a three-dimensional region of interest in an image set.
A three-dimensional numeric measurement of the bounding sphere of a three-dimensional region of interest in an image set.
A three-dimensional numeric measurement of an ellipsoid shaped three-dimensional region of interest in an image set.
A three-dimensional numeric measurement of a sphere shaped three-dimensional region of interest in an image set.
A statistical index of complexity comparing how detail in a fractal pattern changes with the scale at which it is measured; a ratio of the change in detail to the change in scale.
Measure of the asymmetry of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable about its mean.
Measure of the peakedness of the probability distribution of a real-valued random variable.

para.emphasis: The zero order entropy of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). A measure of disorder. Abbreviated ENT.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (TU9B, IBSI, "Joint Entropy of GLCM")

td.para: Root Angular Second Moment of GLCM
The square root of the Angular Second Moment (ASM) of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). A measure of orderliness.
Sometimes referred to as "energy", "uniformity" or "uniformity of energy" but then potentially confused with ASM. Not defined in

para.emphasis: The Inverse Difference Moment (homogeneity) of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). Abbreviated IDM.
Other concepts are sometimes referred to as "homogeneity", e.g., the "inverse difference", which is calculated from the absolute value of differences rather than square of them.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (WF0Z, IBSI, "Inverse Difference Moment of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The sum of squares of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). A measure of gray level variations. Abbreviated CON.
Distinct from "joint (sum of squares) variance" and "dissimilarity".
The dissimilarity of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). Abbreviated DIS.
Distinct from "contrast", which uses square rather than absolute value of difference.
The Angular Second Moment of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). Abbreviated ASM.
Sometimes referred to as "energy", "uniformity" or "uniformity of energy" but then potentially confused with square root of ASM.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (8ZQL, IBSI, "Angular Second Moment of GLCM")

para.emphasis: A measure of the linear dependency of gray levels on those of neighbouring pixels of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM). Abbreviated COR.
Correlation is NaN for a constant image.

td.para: A tabulation of how often different combinations of pixel values (gray levels) occur in an image. Abbreviated GLCM.
The tabulation of gray level run lengths in a particular direction in an image. Abbreviated GLRLM.
A tabulation of counts of the number of groups of connected voxels with a specific discretized gray level value and size. Abbreviated GLSZM.

emphasis.emphasis: A tabulation of counts of the number of groups (or zones) of linked voxels that share a specific discretised grey level value and possess the same distance to ROI edge. Abbreviated GLDZM.

A matrix containing the sum of grey level differences of pixels/voxels with a discretised grey level and average discretised grey level of neighbouring pixels/voxels within a specified Chebyshev distance. Abbreviated NGTDM.
A tabulation of the counts of dependent (within a specified coarseness parameter) neighbouring discretised grey levels within a specified Chebyshev distance. Abbreviated NGLDM.

para.emphasis: The probability corresponding to the most common gray level co-occurrence in the GLCM. Abbreviated MAX.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (GYBY, IBSI, "Joint Maximum of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The gray level weighted sum of joint probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (60VM, IBSI, "Joint Average of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The sum of squares of the difference from the joint average of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (UR99, IBSI, "Joint Variance of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The average for the diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (TF7R, IBSI, "Difference Average of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The variance for the diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (D3YU, IBSI, "Difference Variance of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The entropy for the diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (NTRS, IBSI, "Difference Entropy of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The average for the cross-diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (ZGXS, IBSI, "Sum Average of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The variance for the cross-diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (OEEB, IBSI, "Sum Variance of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The entropy for the cross-diagonal probabilities of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (P6QZ, IBSI, "Sum Entropy of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The inverse difference of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

Sometimes referred to as "homogeneity" but that term is historically used to refer to the "inverse difference moment", which is calculated from the square of differences rather than absolute value of them.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (IB1Z, IBSI, "Inverse Difference of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The normalized inverse difference of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (NDRX, IBSI, "Normalized Inverse Difference of GLCM")

para.emphasis: Inverse Difference Moment Normalized of GLCM
The normalized inverse difference moment of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (1QCO, IBSI, "Normalized Inverse Difference Moment of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The inverse variance of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (E8JP, IBSI, "Inverse Variance of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The autocorrelation of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).
The cluster tendency of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (DG8W, IBSI, "Cluster Tendency of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The cluster shade of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (7NFM, IBSI, "Cluster Shade of GLCM")

para.emphasis: The cluster prominence of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (AE86, IBSI, "Cluster Prominence of GLCM")

para.emphasis: First Measure of Information Correlation of GLCM
The first measure of information correlation of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (R8DG, IBSI, "First Measure of Information Correlation of GLCM")

para.emphasis: Second Measure of Information Correlation of GLCM
The second measure of information correlation of a Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM).

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (JN9H, IBSI, "Second Measure of Information Correlation of GLCM")

para.emphasis: A measure of the distribution of short runs in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated SRE.
A measure of the distribution of long runs in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated LRE.
A measure of the distribution of low gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated LGRE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (V3SW, IBSI, "Low Gray Level Run Emphasis")

para.emphasis: A measure of the distribution of high gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated HGRE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (G3QZ, IBSI, "High Gray Level Run Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Short Run Low Gray Level Emphasis
A measure of the joint distribution of short runs and low gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated SRLGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (HTZT, IBSI, "Short Run Low Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Short Run High Gray Level Emphasis
A measure of the joint distribution of short runs and high gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated SRHGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (GD3A, IBSI, "Short Run High Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Long Run Low Gray Level Emphasis
A measure of the joint distribution of long runs and low gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated LRLGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (IVPO, IBSI, "Long Run Low Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Long Run High Gray Level Emphasis
A measure of the the joint distribution of long runs and high gray level values in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated LRHGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (3KUM, IBSI, "Long Run High Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: A measure of the similarity of gray level values throughout the image in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated RLM.GLNU.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (R5YN, IBSI, "Gray Level Nonuniformity in Runs")

para.emphasis: Gray Level Nonuniformity in Runs Normalized
A normalized measure of the similarity of gray level values throughout the image in a gray level run length matrix.
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (OVBL, IBSI, "Normalized Gray Level Nonuniformity in Runs")

para.emphasis: A measure of the the similarity of the length of runs throughout the image in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated RLNU.
A normalized measure of the the similarity of the length of runs throughout the image in a gray level run length matrix.
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (IC23, IBSI, "Normalized Run Length Nonuniformity")

para.emphasis: A measure of the homogeneity and distribution of runs of an image in a specific direction in a gray level run length matrix. Abbreviated RPC.
The variance in runs for the gray levels in a gray level run length matrix.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (8CE5, IBSI, "Gray Level Variance in Runs")

para.emphasis: The variance in runs for run lengths in a gray level run length matrix.
The entropy of runs in a gray level run length matrix.
A feature that emphasizes small zones from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated SZE.
A feature that emphasizes large zones from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated LZE.
A feature that emphasizes low gray level zones from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated LGZE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (XMSY, IBSI, "Low Gray Level Zone Emphasis")

para.emphasis: A feature that emphasizes high gray level zones from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated LGZE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (5GN9, IBSI, "High Gray Level Zone Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Small Zone Low Gray Level Emphasis
A feature that emphasizes small zone sizes and low gray levels from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated SZLGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (5RAI, IBSI, "Small Zone Low Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Small Zone High Gray Level Emphasis
A feature that emphasizes small zone sizes and high gray levels from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated SZHGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (HW1V, IBSI, "Small Zone High Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Large Zone Low Gray Level Emphasis
A feature that emphasizes large zone sizes and low gray levels from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated LZLGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (YH51, IBSI, "Large Zone Low Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Large Zone High Gray Level Emphasis
A feature that emphasizes large zone sizes and high gray levels from a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated LZHGE.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (J17V, IBSI, "Large Zone High Gray Level Emphasis")

para.emphasis: Gray Level Nonuniformity of Zone Counts
The distribution of zone counts over the gray values in a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated SZM.GLNU.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (JNSA, IBSI, "Gray Level Nonuniformity of Size Zone Counts")

para.emphasis: Gray Level Nonuniformity of Zone Counts Normalized
The normalized distribution of zone counts over the gray values in a gray level size zone matrix.
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (Y1RO, IBSI, "Normalized Gray Level Nonuniformity of Size Zone Counts")

para.emphasis: The distribution of zone counts over the different zone sizes in a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated ZSNU.
The normalized distribution of zone counts over the different zone sizes in a gray level size zone matrix.
The US not UK spelling of "normalized" is used to be consistent with the DICOM convention, rather than the IBSI spelling.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (VB3A, IBSI, "Normalized Zone Size Nonuniformity")

para.emphasis: The fraction of the number of realised zones relative to the maximum number of potential zones in a gray level size zone matrix. Abbreviated ZPERC.
The variance ithe variance in zone counts for the gray levels in a gray level size zone matrix.

emphasis.emphasis: Replaced by (BYLV, IBSI, "Gray Level Variance in Size Zones")

para.emphasis: The variance in zone counts for the different zone sizes in a gray level size zone matrix.
The entropy of zone sizes in a gray level size zone matrix.
